2 G uarantee2.1 In consideration for Mazars entering into the Agreement with MetricStream, the Guarantor irrevocably and unconditionally guarantees as primary obligor, and not merely as surety:(a) to pay to Mazars on written demand, and in the currency in which the same falls due for payment, within thirty (30) days become due or owing by MetricStream to Mazars under or in connection with the Agreement; and/or(b) the due and punctual performance by MetricStream of each and all of the obligations, representations, warranties, duties and undertakings of MetricStream under and pursuant to the Agreement when and if the same is due for performance in accordance with the Agreement but only in the event that MetricStream shall in any respect commit any breach of or fail to comply with any such obligations, in which case the Guarantor will forthwith remedy such breach and fulfil such obligation (including any obligation to reimburse or indemnify Mazars) in place of MetricStream.

7.2 If at any time the Guarantor is required by law to make any deduction or withholding in respect of any taxes, duties or other charges or withholdings from any payment due under this Deed, the sum due from the Guarantor in respect of such payment shall be increased to the extent necessary to ensure that, after the making of such deduction or withholding, Mazars receives on the due date and retains (free of anyPage 87 of 111liability in respect of such deduction or withholding) a net sum equal to the sum which it would have received had no such deduction or withholding been required to be made.

11.1 Vendor shall maintain insurance coverage, and on all certificates for coverage under general liability, automobile liability, employer’s liability, worker’s compensation, and any other coverages required under local law, shall:(i) name HDS as an “Additional Insured" (or "Loss Payee" under All Risk Property insurance), including without limitation, as an insured with respect to third-party claims or actions made or brought directly against HDS or against HDS and Vendor as co­defendants and arising out of or in connection with this Agreement; (ii) be written as a primary policy not contributing with any other coverage which HDS may carry; and (iii) stipulate that HDS shall receive thirty (30) days’ prior written notice of any cancellation or reduction in coverage; provided that such cancellation or alteration shall not relieve Vendor of its continuing obligation to maintain insurance coverages in accordance with this Section.

9.2 Payment Terms(a) Credit Suisse shall pay each invoice properly rendered in accordance with this Agreement and not in bona fide dispute within forty-five (45) days following the later of (x) receipt of the invoice, and (y) the date for payment specified below or as otherwise agreed in the Transaction Schedule:(i) License Fees.

(b) Notwithstanding the foregoing, Credit Suisse shall have the option of making the payment within ten (10) days from the date of receipt of a correct invoice and Contracting Party agrees that Credit Suisse shall be entitled to apply a 2% discount against such payment.
Credit Suisse shall not be obligated to pay any invoice delivered by Contracting Party more than three (3) months after completion of the Services to which the invoice pertains.

Any dispute as to payment not resolved within 30 days will be referred for expert determination in accordance with clause 15.2.

16.3 Termination by Service Provider(a) The Service Provider may terminate this Agreement by notice to the Department if the Department fails to pay any part of the Charges when due and payable and such failure is not remedied within 30 days of receiving notice of the failure, provided that such amount is:(i) overdue by 90 days;(ii) greater than $50,000; and(¡ii) not the subject of a Dispute between the parties.

clause 17.1 of the Base Agreement;AML/CFT Act means the Anti-Money Laundering and Countering Financing of Terrorism Act 2009; Annexure means:(a) any document physically attached, or annexed, to a Schedule and Identified as such; and(b) any document referenced in any Schedule or Annexure;Available or Availability means that the System is fully accessible to, usable by and able to process information for, all Users In accordance with the Specifications and otherwise in the manner required by this Agreement;Base Agreement means clauses 1 to 18 (inclusive) of, and Schedule 1 (Definitions) to, this Agreement;Change has the meaning given in Schedule 7 (Change Management);Change Procedure means the change control procedure set out in Schedule 7 (Change Management);Change Request means the written request relating to a proposed change by which the Department or the Service Provider may initiate the Change Procedure;Charges means the amount payable by the Department for the System and the Services, set out in Schedule 5 (Pricing);Commencement Date means the date this Agreement is signed by both parties (or, if two dates, the later date);Control means, in relation to the Service Provider, or any ultimate or intermediate holding company of the Service Provider, the power to:(a) manage, directly or indirectly, the operation of the business of; or(b) control, directly or indirectly, the composition of the board of directors or board of management of,the Service Provider or any ultimate or intermediate holding company, whether through the ownership of voting securities, by contract or otherwise and for these purposes “holding company” will have the same meaning as in section 5 of the Companies Act 1993;Data means all:(a) data constituted by information supplied to or collected by the Service Provider for the purpose of enabling the Service Provider to perform its obligations under this Agreement;Schedule 1 (Definitions)32(b) data, information, records and lists processed or collated by the Service Provider from or as a result of the performance by the Service Provider of its obligations under this Agreement;(c) databases and other compilations of data created by the Department or the Service Provider for the purposes of this Agreement; and(d) Information that establishes audit trails for data collated, processed, created and archived for the purposes of the performance of obligations under this Agreement;Department Environment means the Department s:(a) business, organisational, technical and commercial processes and procedures; and(b) information technology and telecommunications infrastructure and environment (including Software, hardware, systems and networks),as existing from time to time and interfacing with the System;Department Materials means all materials (including Software) existing at the date those materials are first used for the purposes of this Agreement, the Intellectual Property in which is vested in the Department or its licensor, including all adaptations, modifications and new versions of those materials made by the Service Provider, the Department or any third party during the Term;Developed Materials means all materials (including Software and Source Code) that are not Department Materials and are created or developed by the Service Provider (or any Subcontractor) for the purposes of this Agreement, including all adaptations, modifications and new versions of those materials;Disengagement Services means:(a) developing a detailed disengagement plan to assist the seamless migration of the Services to the Department or any successor service provider, and submitting that plan to the Department for its approval;(b) returning Data, Software, and Department Materials to the Department or to a successor service provider, as requested by the Department;(c) delivering Developed Materials to the Department or to a successor service provider, as requested by the Department; and(d) such other services as the Department and the Service Provider mutually agree upon to ensure an orderly and timely migration of the Services from the Service Provider to it or any successor service provider;Dispute has the meaning given to It by clause 15.1 of the Base Agreement;Documentation means all documentation and reports relating to the System, as are reasonably necessary for the Department to use, support, operate and obtain the full benefit of the System (including specifications, manuals, processes descriptions, methodologies, user guides, data models, system schematics and maps, database schema and file content descriptions, maintenance records, maintenance libraries, and procedures), and includes all documentation that must be provided by the Service Provider under this Agreement and has been, or will be, prepared or used by the Service Provider for the purpose of providing the Services;Document Finalisation Process has the meaning given to it In Schedule 9 (Document Finalisation Process)Schedule 1 (Definitions)33Force Majeure Event means an event beyond the reasonable control of either party which makes it impossible or illegal to perform, or prevents compliance with, or the performance of, that party’s obligations under this Agreement, excluding any event:(a) if, and to the extent that, the effect of that event could have been substantially prevented, avoided or mitigated by:(i) exercising a reasonable standard of care; or(ii) using information provided by the other party or available in the public domain;(b) for which the affected party is or was directly responsible;(c) constituted by the failure of a Subcontractor unless and to the extent that the Subcontractor was itself affected by an event which, if it occurred in relation to either party, would have been a Force Majeure Event; or(d) constituted by the insolvency of either party or lack of funds;Good Industry Practice means, in relation to the Service Provider’s performance of the Services, the exercise of the skill, diligence, prudence, foresight and judgement which would be expected from a highly skilled and experienced person engaged in the same type of undertaking under the same or similar circumstances, applying the standards and practices currently generally applied in the New Zealand technology industry;GST means goods and services tax payable under the Goods and Services Tax Act 1985;Implementation means the activities, functions and services of the Service Provider set out in Schedule 3 (Implementation);Implementation Milestone means each Implementation milestone set out in the Project Plan;Implementation Milestone Date means each due date for achievement of an Implementation Milestone, set out in the Project Plan;Implementation Period means the period starting on the date that the Verification Milestone is achieved and ending on the Acceptance Date;Initial Term means a period of five years from the Commencement Date;Insolvency Event means, in relation to the Service Provider:(a) the presentation of an application for its liquidation that is not discharged within 30 days of its filing or which is not demonstrated to the Department prior to the expiry of that 30 day period as being an application that is frivolous or vexatious;(b) any step taken in or toward the making of any compromise, proposal or deed of arrangement with all or some of its creditors;(c) the appointment of a liquidator, receiver, statutory manager, or similar official;(d) the suspension or threatened suspension of the payment of its debts;(e) cessation of a whole or any relevant part of its business; or(f) the enforcement of any security against the whole or a substantial part of its assets;Schedule 1 (Definitions)34Intellectual Property means copyright, trade mark, design, patent, semiconductor or circuit layout rights, trade or other proprietary rights or rights derivative of those rights as well as any other rights in intellectual property which are recognised or protected under Law;Key Personnel means those Personnel listed in paragraph 3.4 of Schedule 6 (Governance), as augmented or replaced from time to time in accordance with the terms of this Agreement, and Key Person means any person who is a member of the Key Personnel;Law means:(a) any statute, regulation, bylaw, ordinance or subordinate legislation in force from time to time to which either party is subject;(b) the common law and the law of equity as applicable to the parties from time to time;(c) any binding industry code, policy or standard enforceable by law; and(d) any applicable direction, policy, permission, consent, licence rule or order that is binding on either party and that is made or given by any governmental, legal or regulatory body having jurisdiction over either party or any of that party’s assets, resources or business,In any jurisdiction that is applicable to this Agreement;Objectives has the meaning given In clause 2.1 of the Base Agreement;Personnel includes employees, agents, officers and independent individual contractors;Problem has the meaning in paragraph 6.5 of Schedule 3 (Implementation);Professional Service Rates means the rates set out in paragraph 7 of Schedule 5 (Pricing);Project Plan means the operative document which sets out the plan for the conduct of Implementation, attached to Schedule 3 (Implementation);Relationship Manager has the meaning given in paragraph 2.1 of Schedule 6 (Governance)Requirements means the Department’s requirements for the System and the Services, set out in this Agreement (including Annexure A to Schedule 2 (Requirements)) and in the documents referenced by this Agreement, as amended from time to time in accordance with the Change Procedure;RFP means the request for proposals in relation to the implementation and support of the System, Issued by the Department on 23 October 2012;RFP Response means the Service Provider’s response to the RFP, as clarified and amended by subsequent correspondence or material (including questions and answers, whether provided in writing or at any Interview or presentation made to the Department) between the Department and the Service Provider prior to the Commencement Date;Services means any and all of the deliverables and services to be provided, and obligations to be performed, by the Service Provider under this Agreement, including Verification, Implementation, Support and Disengagement Services (if any);Service Credit means a credit to be applied against the Charges in the event of a Service Level Default, in accordance with Annexure A to Schedule 4 (Support);Service Credit Pool has the meaning in clause 2.7(c) of the Base Agreement;Schedule 1 (Definitions)35Service Level means a performance standard to be met by the Service Provider when performing Support, set out in Annexure A to Schedule 4 (Support);Service Level Default means a failure by the Service Provider to meet a Service Level;Service Provider Materials means all materials (including Software) that are:(a) not Developed Materials or Department Materials; and(b) existing at the date those materials are first used for the purposes of this Agreement,the Intellectual Property in which is vested in the Service Provider (or its licensor), including all adaptations, modifications and new versions of those materials;Software means the object code version of any software, database, or protocol, together with any updates, releases, versions, corrections, modifications, enhancements or developments and related Documentation;Source Code means, in relation to any Software, the human readable form of that Software and includes all documentation, algorithms, technical data, tools and any other materials necessary for a reasonably competent software developer to understand, modify and support that Software;Specifications means the Verification deliverables that describe the System;Subcontractor means any person to whom the Service Provider has subcontracted any part of its obligations under this Agreement and includes the employees and subcontractors of that person and like terms will be construed accordingly;Support means any and all of the support services to be provided, and obligations to be performed, by the Service Provider relating to the System during the Term, as set out in Schedule 4 (Support);System means the complete AML/CFT compliance monitoring and regulatory management system and associated deliverables to be provided by the Service Provider under this Agreement;Term means the Initial Term, and all Extended Terms (if any);User means any person using, or interacting with, the System, including Department Personnel;Verification means the mutually agreed upon verification activities, functions and services to be provided by the Service Provider to the Department as set out in Schedule 2 (Verification);Verification Milestone means the Department’s written acceptance, in its sole discretion, that the Specifications meet the Requirements;Verification Milestone Date means the due date for achievement of the Verification Milestone as set out in paragraph 7 of Schedule 2 (Verification); andVirus means any program code or programming instructions, or any thing or device, which may damage, interfere with, impair or otherwise adversely affect the operation of the System, prevent or hinder access to any program or data, or enable unauthorised access to any program or data, impair or disrupt the operation of any program or the reliability of any data (whether by re-arranging, altering or erasing the program or data in whole or part or otherwise), including malicious code, trojan horses, worms, spyware, malware, computer viruses, logic bombs, backdoors, disabling code and other similar things.

4.6 Subject to paragraph 4.5, if the Service Provider fails to achieve the Implementation Milestone Date for the Acceptance Date the Service Provider will pay the Department $35,000 in liquidated damages for every month after the Implementation Milestone Date that an acceptance certificate is not issued in accordance with paragraph 6.9 of this Schedule 3 (Implementation).

Each party will have the right to terminate this Agreement or any individual Order Schedule if the other party fails to perform any material obligation under this Agreement or Order Schedule (including the obligation to pay license fees when due) and fails to cure such nonperformance within thirty (30) days following written notice of such failure.

The circumstances under which the Source Code will be released from escrow are as follows:(1) Certus becomes insolvent or admits insolvency or admits a general inability to pay its debts as they become due; or(2) Certus files a petition for protection under the bankruptcy code of the United States, or an involuntary petition in bankruptcy is filed against Certus and is not dismissed within sixty (60) days thereafter; or(3) Certus or its successor in interest ceases to support the Software in breach of its obligations under the Maintenance and Support Addendum.

Payments for Covered Services provided by Diplomat shall be made within forty-five (45) days when applicable claims are adjudicated electronically via WPS's Diplomat management system and sixty (60) days when claims are submitted to WPS on paper claims submitted in the proper, Clean Claim format as defined by the State of Michigan.

Failure to pay undisputed amounts within sixty (60) days specified herein shall result in interest accruing on the unpaid account at a rate of ten percent (10%) per annum from the date payment is due hereunder until payment in full is received by Diplomat.
Finally, all payments to Diplomat shall be accompanied by an EOB (Explanation of Benefits) document within three (3) days of such payment.

In the event of an overpayment or underpayment to Diplomat by WPS, either party shall notify the other of such e1rnneous payment within ten (10) business days of becoming aware of such e11·oneous payment and shall return or arrange the return of such erroneous payment to the other pmty.
No interest shall be due on such erroneous payments provided repayment occurs within thirty (30) days from date of discovery.

WPS shall be permitted to obtain reimbursement for overpayments made to Diplomat by offsetting the amount of such overpayment against future payments due or obtaining reimbursement from Diplomat of such overpayments, however such offsetting shall not occur until after a minimum twenty (20) day cure period and such offset is adequately identified on the EOB provided that includes the offset to payment.

Payment shall be made within thirty (30) days following the end of each measurement period in default.

Such quarterly reconciliations, along with any related inventory reconciliation and reimbursement payments as described below shall occur within ten (10) days following the end of such quarter during the term of this Agreement (e.g., by January 10, April 10, July 10 and October 10, respectively).

The first payment due Hospital under the terms of this Section 6.1 shall be delayed until the later of: (i) six (6) weeks following the Effective Date of this Agreement; or (ii) until an executed Contract Administrator Agreement is in place and effective.

V. PAYMENT TO PROVIDER A. TriWest will use best efforts to process Clean Claims within thirty (30) days of receipt and will make payment directly to Provider for Covered Services rendered by Provider to TRICARE Beneficiaries in accordance with the Reimbursement Rates set forth in Exhibit 1.

If Provider still believes that TriWest' s determination of payment or non-payment is inconcct and/or has information that was not previously available for review when submitted to TriWest, Provider may direct a second request for review in writing to TriWest within sixty (60) days of receipt of the prior determination.

Invoices are due NET 30 Client agrees to pay CareWorks a late charge of one and one half percent (1J4%) per month or the maximum lawful rate, whichever is less, for all amounts not paid within thirty (45) days of receipt of invoice.

CareWorks may discontinue Services if Client fails to pay any sum due within sixty (60) days after receipt of invoice if, after five (5) days notice by CareWorks of Client's failure to pay, such failure to pay has not been cured.

With the exception of fraud or as otherwise required by law or regulatory agencies, all requests for correction of claim payment(s) or CHC-KSMO-CON-I26-09.07_Ancillary_all Page 4 of 15 recovery by Provider, Health Plan or Payor shall be limited to three hundred sixty-five (365) days from the date Health Plan or Payor paid the claim.
Coventry Company shall use best efforts to require Payors to pay Provider within thirty (30) days receipt of a claim that is accurate, complete, and otherwise in accordance with this section.

(b) If Tenant shall default in the payment of Fixed Rent reserved hereunder, or any item of Additional Rent, or any part of either or in making any other payment herein provided for and such default is not cured within ten ( 10) days of Landlord's notice to Tenant, or if noti~ pursuant to subparagraph (a) of this Section 26 shall have been given and if the con<lition which was the basis of said notice shall exist at the expiration of said ten ( I 0) day period (subject to the exception for conditions the nature of which aren't reasonably curable within such ten (10) day period), Landlord may immediately, or at any time thereafter, re-enter the Premises and remove all persons and all or any property therefrom, either by summary dispossess proceedings or by any suitable action or proceeding at law, or by force or otherwise, without being liable to indictment, prosecution or damages therefor, and re-possess and enjoy the Premises together with all additions, alterations and improvements.
